Play player turns for all players

play_player_turns.Rd

Allows each player (human or computer) to play their turn for all hands (with hit/stand/double logic).

Usage

play_player_turns(player_hands, deck, players)

Arguments

player_hands

A named list of lists of blackjack_hand objects, one list per player.

deck

Character vector of remaining cards.

players

Named list of player info (fields: 'coins', 'bets', 'is_computer', etc.).

Value

A list:

player_hands

Updated list of player hands.

deck

Updated deck after all turns.

players

Updated player info.

Examples

# Automated play for 2 computer players (does not require user input)
# \donttest{
  player_hands <- list(
    Alice = list(new_blackjack_hand(c("9♠", "7♦"))),
    Bob = list(new_blackjack_hand(c("5♣", "K♥")))
  )
  deck <- c("8♣", "2♦", "4♠")
  players <- list(
    Alice = list(coins = 800, bets = 100, is_computer = TRUE),
    Bob = list(coins = 800, bets = 100, is_computer = TRUE)
  )
  play_player_turns(player_hands, deck, players)
#> 
#> --- Alice ('computer') Playing ---
#> Hand 1: [9♠ 7♦]
#> Score: 16 
#> Computer chooses to hit.
#> You now have: [ 9♠ 7♦ 8♣ ]
#> Score: 24 
#> 
#> --- Bob ('computer') Playing ---
#> Hand 1: [5♣ K♥]
#> Score: 15 
#> Computer chooses to hit.
#> You now have: [ 5♣ K♥ 2♦ ]
#> Score: 17 
#> Computer chooses to stand.
#> You now have: [ 5♣ K♥ 2♦ ]
#> Score: 17 
#> $player_hands
#> $player_hands$Alice
#> $player_hands$Alice[[1]]
#> $cards
#> 9♠ 7♦ 8♣ 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "blackjack_hand"
#> 
#> 
#> $player_hands$Bob
#> $player_hands$Bob[[1]]
#> $cards
#> 5♣ K♥ 2♦ 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "blackjack_hand"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $deck
#> [1] "4♠"
#> 
#> $players
#> $players$Alice
#> $players$Alice$coins
#> [1] 800
#> 
#> $players$Alice$bets
#> [1] 100
#> 
#> $players$Alice$is_computer
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> 
#> $players$Bob
#> $players$Bob$coins
#> [1] 800
#> 
#> $players$Bob$bets
#> [1] 100
#> 
#> $players$Bob$is_computer
#> [1] TRUE
#> 
#> 
#> 
# }

# Human-computer mix (will prompt for user input)
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  player_hands <- list(
    Alice = list(new_blackjack_hand(c("9♠", "7♦"))),
    Bob = list(new_blackjack_hand(c("5♣", "K♥")))
  )
  deck <- c("8♣", "2♦", "4♠")
  players <- list(
    Alice = list(coins = 800, bets = 100, is_computer = FALSE), # Will prompt for input!
    Bob = list(coins = 800, bets = 100, is_computer = TRUE)
  )
  play_player_turns(player_hands, deck, players)
} # }
